titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of research materials compiled by David Stuntz about his ancestor, Conrad Stuntz. The collection includes a photocopy of a incomplete typescript of a novel by Hugh C. Stuntz titled A Family Tree Grows in America whose central character is Conrad Stuntz, who fought in the American Revolution. There are also two binders of genealogical research which include correspondence relating to the research; photocopies of original records such as deeds, membership applications, and legal documents; photocopies of books and articles; a few photographs and publications; research notes; Stuntz, Barnhart and related families genealogy; and other related materials. Some of the research was conducted by Jane Adams Clarke.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
